meanings.definition: The arrangement of events or items in a particular order.
meanings.sent1: The sequencing of the story made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: She used sequencing to organize her daily tasks.
meanings.sent3: The sequencing of the events in the movie was so clear, even a child could understand.
meanings.sent4: His sequencing of the ingredients in the recipe was like a carefully choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used sequencing to teach the students about historical timelines.

meanings.definition: The process of determining the order of nucleotides in a DNA molecule.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use sequencing to decode the genetic information.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician performed DNA sequencing to identify the genetic mutation.
meanings.sent3: The sequencing of the DNA strands was like solving a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the sequencing process was crucial for accurate results.
meanings.sent5: The breakthrough in DNA sequencing revolutionized genetic research.
